text: "Today I came around 7:00 pm

I was completely shocked when I saw the other orders have led on their juices. I asked for the girl's name in order to mention her name in this review but the guy worker did not give me her name
column9: and tries to justify for her in which means they support her lie. It would not cost the female worker anything to tell the truth and to cover it with led but it cost her the message that she wants me to get from her side. This place lacks professionalism and they play dumb with Muslim customers. Please Manager if you see my comment consider it really well because they do not have respect for customer's race and ethnicity. By your role and duty
column10: you can stop this by stop hiring this kind of employee who lies for no reason for customers and play dumb with them."

column5: but I seem to remember them being better. Maybe it was an off day but the lettuce was browning and the meat was very overcooked to the point of being burnt. I think it might be better to go when it's busier (so the surface of the meat hasn't been directly on the heat for so long)

author: J
text: "I ordered food for delivery
column5: and I was extremely satisfied with the taste and yes mainly with the perfectly well condition of food. If you are ordering online for delivery like me
column6: will recommend ordering any type of sauce on the side
column7: so your food will not get soggy by the time it reaches you. Food was so appetizing
column8: it made my day. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone who is craving some  mediterranean food
column9: and to those who want to try something new. Also if you are a sweet tooth
column10: go and order all 3 available desserts on the menu
column11: you will not be disappointed.  I loved perfectly balanced taste baba ghanouj
column12: it made me rethink my stand on eggplants(I never liked them muchüòú). Pita bread that came along with the order was fresh and warm. I had pickled stuff add ons
column13: but if you are not big fan of pickles or have duel mind about it avoid them
column14: as they are extremely sour. My order was entirely vegetarian so
column15: I am only vouching for veg food options
column16: but based on taste amd quality of my food I assume other options must be equally well prepared. I love this place and is definitely part of my permanent list. Thanks for the food Mamoun's Falafel."

author: Mo Metwally
text: "Consistently good food here. Been going to the original location with my pop since I was a kid and to this location for decades as well. They have a nice rewards system in place but you need to mention it as they seem to forget to ask for your information at the end of the order. Falafel
column5: lamb
column6: and hummus rarely disappoint at Mamoun's. They finally sell their hot sauce by the bottle and if you like spicy but flavorful grab a bottle. Solid joint."

text: "Always an immensely incredible dining experience overall with Mamoun's. You cannot go wrong with any Mamoun's chain. No matter where you go. Their ingredients are freshly prepared and cooked. Plenty of lettuce

text: 'Food service was really quick and cashier was really friendly. We ordered meat shawarma
column5: side of fries
column6: and falafel. Everything thing was delicious
column7: and well seasoned. The tamarind juice was also very tasty on a hot day!'

author: Tanvi Mehta
text: 'I loved the East village vegetarian pita with extra feta cheese the first time. The second time we ordered through some website and I was missing an item. But the food was tasty.'

author: The Soul Flight
text: 'Ordered on Uber Eats and had to come here to leave a review because this is DELICOUS! We had a baba ganouj sandwich
column5: a falafel sandwich
column6: and grape leaves. Everything was great and tasted really fresh. I love that there are some great options you can add to the sandwiches/platters .\n\nOnly thing I didn‚Äôt love is that the falafel sandwich didn‚Äôt really have much falafel in it
column7: but all the other great ingredients and the sesame sauce made it worth it.'

author: vishal parekh
text: 'Best Falafel in town!'

author: Leanna Turner
text: 'Contemplated if I was going to write this review. My sister talked me into this place
column5: however upon arrival via GPS
column6: we noticed a new location. Purchased a chicken kabob over salad and shawarma sandwich over rice and waiting for the food to be prepared. Both meals were cold and taste stale. The meats were tough
column7: and the food was absolutely tasteless. The salad didn‚Äôt taste fresh
column8: It tasted as if it was sitting out all day and not refrigerated. However
column9: the mint lemonade was pretty refreshing.\n\nI WOULDNT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT to any real Mediterranean food lovers. For a quick bite

author: Said Zaim
text: "I though that i bough a shish kebab sandwich  turned out that i bought a lettuce and onion sandwich! That's ridiculous"

author: Nahid Rupani
text: "I am all for supporting local businesses during these difficult times but no more Mamoun's for me when they don't know how to treat customers after THEY mess up an order. I was given dry and cold food. Wrong salad. When I called them to let them know
column5: they wanted me to drive all the way back to Hoboken from JC to return a sandwich and a salad after spending $45 with them
column6: this btw was the manager on the phone. WOW! I will take the loss but they will not be seeing my business again. It is unacceptable for businesses to have such an awful attitude. And I hope more people stand up to it."

author: Nilofer Mehta
text: 'We ordered first thing this afternoon and ordered $60 worth of food which was extremely cold
column5: and the original Falafel with hummus didn‚Äôt  have any falafel balls inside and was filled with lettuce and hummus. Very dissatisfied and disappointed with the quality and service..'

author: Kollin Quinn
text: 'I was skeptical of you guys at first. Anything that gets commercialized comes with changes but I have to say the food was really good and tasted just like the original in NY. Friendly staff and offered curbside contactless pick up while waiting for it in my car.'

author: R S
text: 'Probably the worst I have ever eaten from them today after 20+ years eating from diff locations. Lamb was dry and over cooked
column5: most likely kept for a long time due to lack of customers. Chicken was insipid and had no flavor. Tahini was bitter and did not taste like it usually does.\n\nProbably should shut down till they can serve the quality they used to. Very disappointing.'

author: Teddie Handler
text: 'Just ordered online from here since I‚Äôm working at Panera Bread tonight and it was close. Oh man that tabouleh was on point! My regular items (baba
column5: grape leaves
column6: falafel) are always great. And the way it was plated shows they Cared when making this food. Bomb af Tonight guys! Thank you and be safe!'

text: 'One of the best falafel in town'
